edu.bu.segrelab.comets
Class Model

java.lang.Object
  edu.bu.segrelab.comets.Model

public abstract class Model
extends java.lang.Object

The abstract base class for a model to be used in COMETS simulations. Any package used with COMETS must extend this class and provide implementations for the abstracted methods.

Examples include an FBAModel that performs flux balance analysis, or a KineticModel that performs some kind of enzyme kinetics instead, or even an AutomatonModel that provides rules for a cellular automaton.

Only the FBAModel has been implemented thus far. The rest are left as an exercise for the student.

Author:
Bill Riehl
See Also:
edu.bu.segrelab.comets.fba.FBAModel

Constructor Detail

Model

public Model()
Method Detail

run

public abstract int run()
Every Model should be instructed at some point to run, and return some kind of integer state value at the end of its run.

Returns:
an int value describing the result of the run

getMediaNames

public abstract java.lang.String[] getMediaNames()
Since this Model in the COMETS framework is intended to describe some kind of biological phenomenon, it should have a list of nutrients that it uses.

Returns:
a String array of media names this model uses

getModelName

public abstract java.lang.String getModelName()
Returns:
the name of this model.

getInfoPanel

public abstract javax.swing.JComponent getInfoPanel()
Each model should provide some kind of informational panel that the COMETS program can use to show the user:
1. What state the model may be in
2. What parameters the model has
3. Anything else of note.

Returns:
a JComponent with model information

sizeOf

public abstract long sizeOf()
A debugging tool. Don't worry about this too much.

Returns:
- returns the memory footprint of the model in KB.
